articles.title: Should You Buy Apple Stock Before May 1?
articles.content: Apple is at the center of increasing geopolitical tensions between the U.S. and China, and investors will want to know how the business is coping.

articles.title: Is Berkshire Hathaway Stock a Buy Now?
articles.content: Berkshire Hathaway has outperformed the broader market during the recent sell-off, and the company's diversified business model and strong cash position make it an attractive investment option. However, the current valuation may be on the high side, so a gradual approach to buying the stock is recommended.

articles.title: Despite Cutting Apple's Price Target, Wedbush's Dan Ives Remains Bullish on the Stock for the Long Term. Should You?
articles.content: Wedbush's Dan Ives remains bullish on Apple stock despite cutting the price target, citing the success of the iPhone and potential boost from AI-driven upgrade cycle. However, the article also highlights Apple's slowing innovation, revenue growth, and high valuation compared to peers, making the long-term outlook uncertain.

articles.title: Pope Francis, The People's Pope, Dies At 88: Tributes Pour In From Trump, King Charles, Tim Cook, Joe Biden, Jimmy Fallon, And More
articles.content: Pope Francis, the revered leader of the Catholic Church, passed away at the age of 88, prompting an outpouring of tributes from global leaders, tech CEOs, and entertainment figures.

articles.title: Apple price target lowered to $256 from $259 at Goldman Sachs
articles.content: Goldman Sachs lowered the firm’s price target on Apple (AAPL) to $256 from $259 but keeps a Buy rating on the shares ahead of its Q2 results. Apple should deliver strong fundamental results driven by new product innovation and resulting channel fill, sell-through pull-forward on tariff-related price increase concerns, rising U.S. carrier competitive intensity, and solid Services performance, the analyst tells investors in a research note. articles.title: Wall Street Bets on Big Tech Buybacks as Free Cash Flow Keeps Flowing
articles.content: Apple, Alphabet, and peers expected to continue buybacks with $100B in Q1 free cash flow across Big Tech

articles.title: Mag 7 rallies, Vertiv surges, solar downgraded: Trending Tickers
articles.content: Julie Hyman and Roundhill Investments CEO Dave Mazza take a closer look at some of the trending tickers of the trading session ahead of the closing bell on Wall Street. The "Magnificent Seven" stocks, made up of Nvidia (NVDA), Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Tesla (TSLA), Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), Meta (META), and Apple (AAPL), rise as the tariff relief rally lifts Big Tech stocks. Vertiv Holdings (VRT) stock surges after the data center cooling system company reported a first quarter earnings beat and raised its full-year sales guidance. Solar equipment stocks Enphase Energy (ENPH) and SolarEdge (SEDG) plunge after Guggenheim analysts downgraded the stocks to Sell. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.
